title: Benefits of Shavasana
content: Shavasana (Corpse Pose) is essential for deep relaxation. It reduces stress, lowers blood pressure, and allows the body to integrate the benefits of practice.

title: Introduction to Pranayama
content: Pranayama is the practice of breath control in yoga. It revitalizes the body, calms the mind, and prepares the practitioner for meditation.

title: Safety Guidelines for Beginners
content: Beginners should prioritize alignment over depth. Listen to your body, use props, and never force a pose. Consult a doctor if you have health concerns.

title: Understanding Sun Salutations
content: Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutation) is a sequence of 12 powerful yoga poses. It improves cardiovascular health, flexibility, and strength.

title: Warrior II Alignment
content: In Virabhadrasana II, keep your front knee stacked over the ankle. Extend arms parallel to the floor and gaze over the front hand.

title: Yoga for Back Pain
content: Gentle poses like Cat-Cow, Child's Pose, and Sphinx can alleviate back pain. Avoid deep backbends if you have acute injury.

title: The Art of Balancing Poses
content: Tree Pose (Vrikshasana) improves focus and balance. Root down through the standing foot and keep your gaze fixed on a point.

title: Benefits of Meditation
content: Meditation reduces anxiety, enhances self-awareness, and promotes emotional health. Even 5 minutes a day can make a difference.

title: Downward Facing Dog Guide
content: Adho Mukha Svanasana stretches the hamstrings and calves. Press into the hands, lift hips high, and relax the head and neck.

title: Common Yoga Mistakes
content: Holding breath, overstretching, and comparing yourself to others are common mistakes. Focus on your own journey.

title: Yoga for Flexibility
content: Consistent practice of asanas like Paschimottanasana (Seated Forward Bend) gradually increases flexibility in the hamstrings and spine.

title: History of Yoga
content: Yoga originated in ancient India over 5,000 years ago. It is a spiritual, mental, and physical practice.

title: Types of Yoga Styles
content: Hatha is slow-paced, Vinyasa is flow-based, and Yin is meditative. Choose a style that suits your current needs.

title: Yoga Props Explained
content: Blocks, straps, and bolsters help modify poses. They make yoga accessible to all body types and prevent injury.

title: Hot Yoga Safety
content: Hot yoga is practiced in a heated room. Stay hydrated and take breaks if you feel dizzy. Consult a doctor if you have heart conditions.

title: Inversions and Glaucoma
content: Inversions like Headstand can increase intraocular pressure. They are contraindicated for individuals with glaucoma.

title: Prenatal Yoga Benefits
content: Prenatal yoga prepares the body for labor. Avoid lying on the back after the first trimester and skip deep twists.

title: Yoga for Stress Relief
content: Restorative yoga triggers the parasympathetic nervous system, helping to lower cortisol levels and reduce stress.

title: Wrist Safety in Yoga
content: Spread fingers wide to distribute weight. If you have carpal tunnel, allow modification like using fists or forearms.

title: The Eight Limbs of Yoga
content: Patanjali's Yoga Sutras outline eight limbs, including Yamas (ethics), Asana (posture), and Dhyana (meditation).

title: Benefits of Twist Poses
content: Twists detoxify the organs and maintain spinal health. Always lengthen the spine before twisting.

title: Core Strength in Yoga
content: Boat Pose (Navasana) and Plank build core strength, which supports the lower back and improves posture.

title: Yoga Nidra Practice
content: Yoga Nidra is 'yogic sleep', a state of conscious relaxation. It is deeply restorative and can improve sleep quality.

title: Chakras Overview
content: There are seven main energy centers (chakras) in the body, from the Root to the Crown using color and sound therapy.

title: Mantra Chanting
content: Chanting 'Om' creates a vibration that calms the nervous system and unifies the group energy in a class.

title: Morning vs Evening Yoga
content: Morning yoga energizes the body. Evening yoga should be calming to prepare for sleep.

title: Neck Safety in Shoulderstand
content: Never turn your head in Sarvangasana. Use a blanket under shoulders to protect the cervical spine.

title: Hypertension and Inversions
content: High blood pressure patients should avoid full inversions or holding breath.

title: Hydration and Yoga
content: Drink water before and after class. During practice, sip small amounts if needed.

title: Consistent Practice
content: Consistency is key. 15 minutes daily is more effective than one long session a week.
